channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 2nd February
item.description:
Customer reports that 2 potholes have reopened at the location, within a few yards of each other. W3W: ///nanny.holds.cattle and ///activism.partly.canine. The first (consecutively) is reported as a foot by 1.5 feet deep and 3.5 feet by 1 foot deep.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog poo bin overflowing, 2nd February
item.description:
Rubbish bags are around the bin and there is rubbish blowing into our garden. This bin is overflowing and has been for over a week now. It is still being used so the issue is only getting worse.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Goldsmith Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Grass verge has been destroyed by cars driving over it. It is now a mud pile. During rain the mud washes into the two nearby drains, blocks them, causing water to be channelled down nearby driveways often flooding the drives. Pavement, road junctions at nos. 49 and 51 are permanently muddy., 2nd February
item.description:
Grass/mud verge at the front of 51 Moorend Park Road Cheltenham GL53 0LA.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 46, Moorend Park Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
